text: Dear Interested Citizen,
label: BODY

text: There is a high level of coal bed methane (CBM) development occurring in the Powder River Basin as well as
label: BODY

text: continued oil well drilling.  Since August, 1999,  the Buffalo BLM Field Office has received approximately 3,600
label: BODY

text: CBM and 24 oil well “Applications for Permits to Drill” (APD’s) on Federal mineral lands in the Powder River
label: BODY

text: Basin.  The majority of these applications are concentrated in the Wyodak EIS area which encompasses most of
label: BODY

text: Campbell County and small portions of eastern Johnson and Sheridan Counties.  Approximately 600 of these
label: BODY

text: applications have been approved and are in various stages of development.   Approximately 500 to 600 hundred
label: BODY

text: additional CBM APD’s could be approved within the parameters of the most recent environmental impact analysis,
label: BODY

text: the Wyodak EIS.  Additional environmental analysis will be necessary to approve APD’s beyond the above level.
label: BODY

text: Because of industry demand to continue development of federal oil and gas, the BLM is intending to prepare an
label: BODY

text: Environmental Impact Statement to analyze the impacts of this action.  Part of the analysis will be to determine if
label: BODY

text: the Buffalo Resource Management Plan needs to be amended in order to enable development to continue.  The
label: BODY

text: amount of foreseeable development within Buffalo Field Office area is estimated to be approximately 30,000 CBM
label: BODY

text: wells and 3,000 oil wells over the next ten years.  These numbers include development on all ownerships.  The
label: BODY

text: analysis will encompass all of the Buffalo Area Field Office which is all of Campbell, Johnson, and Sheridan
label: BODY

text: Counties and a small portion of northern Converse County.
label: BODY

text: We would appreciate hearing any issues or concerns which you feel should be addressed in the analysis.  They can
label: BODY

text: be sent to us on the attached form.  In addition to providing comments we have scheduled four meetings to discuss
label: BODY

text: this analysis.  The meetings are scheduled as follows:
label: BODY

text: Holiday Inn, Sheridan, WY -  June 6, 2000 at 7:00 PM
label: BODY

text: Colonel Bozeman’s, Buffalo, WY - June 7, 2000 at 7:00 PM
label: BODY

text: Holiday Inn, Gillette, WY - June 8, 2000 at 7:00 PM
label: BODY

text: Best Western, Douglas, WY - June 12, 2000 at 7:00 PM
label: BODY

text: The purpose of the meetings is to provide information to the public regarding the proposal so that you can provide
label: BODY

text: informed comments regarding issues and concerns that should be addressed in the Environmental Impact Statement.
label: BODY

text: We would like to receive any comments by June 30, 2000.  If you have no comments but would like to receive a
label: BODY

text: copy of the EIS to review, please return the enclosed form with your name and address.
label: BODY

text: Please note that public comments submitted, including names, addresses and e-mail addresses will be available for
label: BODY

text: public review and disclosure at the above address during business hours.  You may request confidentiality.  If you
label: BODY

text: wish to withhold your name, address or e-mail address from public review or from disclosure under the Freedom of
label: BODY

text: Information Act, you must state this plainly at the beginning of your written comment.  Such requests will be
label: BODY

text: honored to the extent allowable by law.  Any submissions from organizations or businesses, and from individuals
label: BODY

text: identifying themselves as representatives or officials of organizations or businesses, will be made available for
label: BODY

text: public inspection in their entirety.
label: BODY

text: If you have any questions, please contact Paul Beels or Richard Zander at (307) 684-1100.
label: BODY

text: /S/ Dennis R. Stenger
label: BODY
